(season 4) |next = American Idol (season 6) |year = 2006 }} The 'fifth season
ofAmerican Idol' began on January 17, 2006, and concluded on May 24, 2006. Randy
Jackson, Paula Abdul and Simon Cowell returned to judge, and Ryan Seacrest
returned to host. It is the most successful season to date ratings-wise and also
with 18 contestants (including all of the top 10 and a few semifinalists)
getting record deals â nine of them with major labels. It is the first season
with a male winner (Taylor Hicks) and a female runner-up (Katharine McPhee), the
second being season 9, the third being season 10, and the fourth being season
11. It was also the first season of the series to be aired in high definition.
